website_summaries.verdict: Impress your friends and family by quickly whipping up your own homemade pasta.
pros: Roll and cut your own homemade pasta without all the hard work
The intuitive design is perfect for beginners
Sturdy stainless steel parts wipe clean with ease
Attachment fits all KitchenAid stand mixers
cons: Sits at a significantly higher price point

customer_reviews.title: Received with pasta already in it
customer_reviews.text: Nothing like giving a gift with pre made food already in it
customer_reviews.author: J.S.R.

customer_reviews.title: KitchenAid Instructions and Warranty
customer_reviews.text: Took a cooking class at an Italian Restaurant and the chef used a KitchenAid Pasta Roller and Cutter. We ordered ours the next day. Very easy for one person to use. Very reliable. KitchenAid warranty. Makes creating pasta easy and fun.
customer_reviews.author: Mad4Terriers

customer_reviews.title: A must have pasta roller
customer_reviews.text: Its a matter of price decision whether to buy just the pasta roller or the set. The roller is a time and effort savior, you would NOT get the same quality just by hand rolling. The cutters, well.... as I said earlier, price matter decision, I can cut the same way and the same speed, so up to your preference.
customer_reviews.author: Vera Stepenski

customer_reviews.title: This is a must have attachment!!
customer_reviews.text: The pasta attachment for the KitchenAid in my mind are a must after using them. Making your own pasta with the rollers is super easy. The end product is so much better than you can buy in a store. I would honestly say that the spaghetti cutter has left my pasta looking a little more like ramen, but hey fresh ramen works too. I think if you really want to do spagetti right you will likely need a drying rack. I love the sheet roller and the fettuccine cutter they work perfect. I would recommend these attachments to anyone that owns a KitchenAid. This has to be one of my favorite tools in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Jnorth

customer_reviews.title: Well built, Heavy duty construction
customer_reviews.text: Makes the process easy and speedy. Make sure pasta dough is floured well enough as the cutters and rollers wont work smoothly if the dough is at all sticky. I like the metal and heavy construction, the only downside is the price (usual across the board for KitchenAid accessories) and the cleaning process. No pieces fold out or detach to more easily reach for cleaning. Easy to brush dried up buildup away, but I truly feel bad for someone who accidentally puts super sticky dough in the first time and has the machine glob it up.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I love this pasta roller set. I have a manual one from Italy with a hand crank that clamps to the table but it takes at least two people to churn it out. I can make pasta by myself now and it works like a dream I don't know why I waited so long to get this. I've used it twice already since I got it two days ago.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Fit With All Artisan Mixers
customer_reviews.text: I have an older model of the KitchenAid Artisan series and I tried to check the compatibility of the attachment. The system told me "we aren't sure if this fits" and so I checked the Q&A. The seller claims that all attachments fit all mixers and so I purchased the set. This is not the case. On these attachments the screw hole for the knob that secures the attachment to the mixer is slightly off center with my model of mixer and cannot be secured. So if you have an Artisan series mixer I would suggest that you skip this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Keith A Jones

customer_reviews.title: Worthless if you actually need to clean it.
customer_reviews.text: The workmanship and quality of the product is wonderful. Fair warning. If you aren’t a professional cook...if you’ve ever made a single mistake in your life... be forewarned. There is no good way to clean out the recipe that’s left over. There is no way to disassemble this product. The brush that’s included is worthless if you actually use the product or need to clean it. Maddening considering the price.
customer_reviews.author: David Plumb

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy it!
customer_reviews.text: This is second time we used pasta roller. This Rollers for rolling the dough do not spin!!There was a popping noise from the gear mechanism!! Don’t buy this one! Trust me!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tina X.

customer_reviews.title: good quality construction
customer_reviews.text: Well built, good quality construction. Amazingly not made in china. They work well and have good documentation. Unless you are specifically looking for perfectly uniform fettucine or square spaghetti I would suggest getting the roller only then buying the kitchen aid pasta press. You can hand cut fettucine quicker than using the cutter, after the dough is rolled, and the press will give you actual round spaghetti along with several other shapes.
customer_reviews.author: Airboss

customer_reviews.title: Best pasta rolling set ever
customer_reviews.text: I have been coveting this for a while now, and it was totally worth waiting for. As expected from kitchen aid, these attachments feel hefty and durable, definitely quality made. Super easy to get this set up on my kitchen aid stand mixer. It rolls out the pasta dough so quickly, and cuts it super cleanly. I don't even need an extra set of hands to help crank everything out, I can handle it by myself! This is the first set of attachments I have gotten for my kitchen aid, and I can't wait to try out their others if they're all this awesome. Can't recommend enough!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy excellent fettuccine noodles!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. Rarely have I made scratch pasta but this made my first batch perfectly. I used a recipe of 1 1/2 cups each semolina and all-purpose flours, 4 (room temperature) eggs, 4 tablespoons olive oil, 4 tablespoons water and 1 teaspoon salt. Watching a few videos helped. There is no Al Dente bite but still it was excellent even with the soft texture from the eggs and freshness. Was a very good carbonara. Made so many noodles that I froze some. Making a half batch next time. Next gyoza skins for pot stickers and mayve ravioli. I'll get the hang of the drying rack
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: I enjoy these a lot
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy these a lot. I use all three rollers to make noodles for soup and to make dumpling wrappers. My only complaint is that you're not supposed to get them wet and that it's hard to clean them because bits of pasta get stuck inside them. I find myself shaking them to try to get the dried bits to fall out. Inevitably, a few dried bits will find there way into the dough the next time I make pasta. I feel like with a little ingenuity they could design pasta rollers that could be easily opened and cleaned after each use. Never-the-less, it works fine and the pasta is delicious.
customer_reviews.author: M. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy when I got this kit. And the same evening I decided to cook dumplings. Also was very upset, because it does not work. Rollers for rolling the dough do not spin. Tomorrow I will return it back.
customer_reviews.author: Larysa

customer_reviews.title: Used Equipment!
customer_reviews.text: Today I received this KitchenAid pasta making set. The pasta roller was covered in old, dried out dough. It was used! All that money for a used pasta roller? Amazon was nice enough to order a replacement, but...I've got to package it back up and drive to town to a UPS station to return it. And my granddaughter was scheduled to come over tomorrow and make pasta with me. Now we'll have to reschedule for next week. I can't believe this happened. In the same shipment, I got a wooden pasta rack that reeked of mold, and a kitchen timer that was used and broken. I'd expect this kind of quality at a rummage sale, not at Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Great fun
customer_reviews.text: First you have to like the process but the results are great. Fresh pasta using this attachment on your KitchenAid is the only way to go. Wife loves to cook and pasta is her specialty. The directions were very good and with a couple of youtube videos you too can be on the fast track for fresh pasta. She is really happy therefore I am happy and well fed. The motorized contraption is worth the extra money so get the real deal with a certified KitchenAid attachment.
customer_reviews.author: S. Matson

customer_reviews.title: Make Pasta with Ease
customer_reviews.text: The pictures do not do these justice. They are actually very large, very heavy and make short work out of making pasta. Cleaning can be a pain but it's worth it if you love real, fresh pasta.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: She broke it in a day.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my wife. She made pasta first day. Jammed the roller, and the sheer Pin did its job. Instead of damaging the motor in the stand mixer, the pin snapped. Only problem is replacing the sheer pin, the piece designed to fail, is $49(on an assembly that sells for $65 total). Seems a little excessive for what is essentially a tiny machined hex to square pin with a manufacturered weak point in it.
customer_reviews.author: Lucid Drem

customer_reviews.title: The third time we used pasta roller it broke. What a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.text: The third time we used pasta roller it broke. What a piece of junk. There was a popping noise from the gear mechanism and of the main drive turns none of the rollers do
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: super nice product
customer_reviews.text: The product quality is very solid and well built. Setup was very easy, it takes a little practice to get the dough feeding evenly into the compression rollers, this is important so you have nice straight dough strips to feed into the cutter rollers. Just need to perfect the dough recipe.
customer_reviews.author: CJT

customer_reviews.title: No way to clean out dried up pasta. It ...
customer_reviews.text: No way to clean out dried up pasta. It comes with a brush but you cannot get all the pasta out. The pasta dries inside the product and there is no way to open it up to clean out
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great investment!
customer_reviews.text: I've always wanted one, but wasn't sure if it was worth the purchase...finally caved in and bought this recently after years of contemplating...used it once and I'm hooked...fresh pasta is the best pasta!!! I gave it 4 stars as I wish the instruction guide has recipes (such as herbed pasta, etc.) and troubleshooting techniques for pasta not to stick on the attachment, etc. as I'm a novice user of this tool. Had to do thorough research and it took time to find a recipe I could work with. Other than that great kitchen tool/item and no regrets on purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Alibabalu

customer_reviews.title: Love this...but..
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived on schedule and in perfect condition. It seems very well made and worked great! I made pasta as per the enclosed recipe and added some dried basil, delicious! However, one of the reasons I bought this set was to make gluten free pasta for my daughter and granddaughter who have celiac disease. The roller and cutters don’t come apart and can’t be cleaned thoroughly enough to prevent cross contamination that they must avoid. I considered sending it back, but I’ll probably use it quite a bit when they’re not visiting. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic attachment
customer_reviews.text: I have had the manual pasta maker for years, and while the results are great, the whole process is a mess, and it requires two people to operate, one turning the handle, the other feeding the dough. Enter the Kitchenaid pasta roller attachment. Making noodles or lasagna now takes minutes and no extra hands are needed. Tip: make sure the dough is not sticky, flour each morsel generously, and cool dough for half hour before rolling. If you follow these steps, nothing will stick and the rolling attachment won't have to be cleaned at all. Wonderful, sturdy, a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel S.

customer_reviews.title: Makes easy work of rolling out pasta dough
customer_reviews.text: Makes easy work of rolling out pasta dough. My only complaint is that you have to roll out your dough fairly thin before putting it through the first setting. Thinner than of you were working with a hand crank. But honestly, it’s a small price to pay for the convenience this procudct produces.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C

customer_reviews.title: Changed my life
customer_reviews.text: My brother said when he got his set it "changed his life". If you're making noodles by hand or with a hand crank machine, the advantages to this set are hard to overstate. Two best things.1) You need 3 or 4 hands to use the crank machine--this gives you two 2) It puts the machine much higher off the work surface so using both your hands to handle the dough/noodles is just FUN. I know they're pricey, but they'll out last you probably.
customer_reviews.author: denpick

customer_reviews.title: Quality has changed
customer_reviews.text: Either this isn't the real KitchenAid brand or they have started using inferior materials in the product. I purchased a set a year or so ago and they were all metal and very good quality. I purchased these last month for our secondary home and much of it is now plastic and they don't work as well. The dough gets stuck in the cutters and clumps together. The roller is plastic as well as the dial on the roller. The only positive thing is that the numbers are easier to read on the roller now. I am very disappointed in KitchenAid if they have moved to plastic in this product line.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne R

customer_reviews.title: Pasta Parties for Days
customer_reviews.text: So my hubby is Italian and loves to make pasta on occasion. I know it's not the easiest thing to make and owning a Kitchen Aid I figured I can help his passuin along and purchased this set. We practiced making perogi until he got the hang of it and more confident. Now he is a pro at it and we have fresh pasta regularly. Love this attachment as I don't have to purchase an entirely new machine and have less room taken up in my kitchen as well. This is attachment is easy to maintain as long as you follow thw directions provided by Kitchen Aid. Love this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: La Educada

customer_reviews.title: Real Kitchen Aid
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, but hard to clean. Otherwise, a great product and i am happy. If we experience a pasta shortage again, i am set for making my own which is a good idea anyway. Covid-19 lock down cleaned the local food store shelves of pasta for weeks and local Kitchen Aid shelves. My unit arrived from California and i live in Florida. If you have a Kitchen Aid mixer, this is an item i suggest you have in your cabinet along with several other attachments.
customer_reviews.author: John P Scott

customer_reviews.title: A kitchen classic.
customer_reviews.text: I had a cheap stand mixer for many years that I bought when I was in grad school and had no money. I always had Kitchen Aid envy, so I bought this one. I can absolutely see the difference. I use this frequently and I'm happy with the purchase. It does a better job mixing and is significantly quieter than the knock off brand.
customer_reviews.author: That is correct.

customer_reviews.title: So happy
customer_reviews.text: My 2 kids and I have been having so much fun with this pasta maker. We use a simple dough recipe (amp flour, eggs, water and salt) the kids love to run the dough through the flattening rollers, it’s fun as the dough gets longer and longer. We have made both fettuccine and spaghetti. The fettuccine is better IMO, has a great texture. The spaghetti was good but was just like store bought. We are going to have a good time making new flavors and colors of pasta. I am hoping I can flatten fondant and tortilla with the attachment. Maybe I can retire my rolling pin
customer_reviews.author: Hello Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Roller is the best piece of the set
customer_reviews.text: The pasta roller is great. I probably won't make spaghetti enough to make the cutters worthwhile. Though it was cool to watch it coming out cut out the bottom of the cutter, it was kind of a pain to separate it all to dry it. I should have bought just the roller by itself....way cheaper. Note that though this is "prime", you cannot return, only exchange it for another item. There's nothing else I want that costs as much so I guess I'm stuck with it. If you are on the fence like I was about this set or just the roller, get just the roller and save $70.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Experienced Cooks only
customer_reviews.text: After reading some of the other reviews, I can understand why they were frustrated. However, a good knowledge of dough, and basic chemistry will get you a long way here. They function beautifully if you have made the dough properly, let it rest, and keep it floured. When I first used them, I was ready to send them back, too. I had holes, bubbles, and ripples! Then I went online to a blogger who makes pasta dough, fixed my dough mistakes, and Voila!! Spaghetti and Fetuccini that were so good, we've boycotted Olive Garden forever. We had pasta three nights that week! Raviolis are quite a bit more challenging, I'm still working on my technique.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really a nice addition to the other kitchen aide tools I use.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why I waited so long to purchase these, but they have been wonderful and a joy to use. When Covid hit, and all the stores where out of everything, I had lots of home-made spaghetti sauce put up but no pasta. My son had gotten one of these as a wedding gift and the pasta they made with it was wonderful. So, I bought one and made my own. Turned out fabulous!
customer_reviews.author: Nogrey

customer_reviews.title: KitchenAid makes it better!
customer_reviews.text: I started with a manual pasta roller/cutter and feel in love with fresh pasta. I could not believe how much different it is compared to box pasta. For nearly 6 months I have been cranking out pasta. Finally decided to invest in the kitchenaid pasta roller and WOW!!! It is wonderful to use! My kids have enjoyed making pasta with me but now I'm kind of being pushed out of the way. Making pasta with your family is the best quality time ever. THANK YOU KITCHEN AIDE!
customer_reviews.author: One happy shopper

customer_reviews.title: I'm delighted with this pasta roller set
customer_reviews.text: I've not had this set very long, so I will have to update this review later. So far, I've only used the pasta roller, and I've used that only for cracker dough. But oh, what a blessing it has been, just for that! The roller is easy to install, easy to use, and it works perfectly! I did read the instructions carefully, to be sure the cracker dough I use would be compatible. I am looking forward to trying my hand at pasta soon. That's going to be fun!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Love my pasta maker
customer_reviews.text: This makes it so much easier to make fresh pasta than doing it by hands or with a hand crank machine. I should have bought one years ago instead of waiting till recently. With yeast being a bit hard to find at local grocery store, I have not make fresh pasta in awhile. It is definitely a must have for anyone with a Kitchenaid and want to make fresh pasta.
customer_reviews.author: stargazer

customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Before receiving this, I would make pasta with the hand crank machine. This is SO MUCH EASIER and FASTER! I was so amazed at how heavy duty these were when I opened them. I can't believe it used to take me four hours to make a batch of pasta with the old hand crank machine. I love KitchenAid products and their excellent customer service. I also have the spiralizer. I love these attachments.
customer_reviews.author: Kat n Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Makes Pasta Making Easy
customer_reviews.text: Makes Pasta making easy. While I love my manual pasta maker--it needs two people. I am now single, so I lost my partner pasta marker :(. At the writing of this review I have had the rollers and cutters for 3 months and have used them 6 times--all with success. Even made lasagna noodles which resulted in a light and delicious lasagna.
customer_reviews.author: sheila

customer_reviews.title: 3-Piece Pasta Roller and Cutter
customer_reviews.text: I used the product to make pasta yesterday and it is much easier than the manual one that I had - It is basically the same product, but instead of having to stow it on table and crank it to roll and cut you attach it to your Kitchen aid processor and it is really easy to work with. I really liked it. As for Durability, Easy to clean i can't rate at this time because i barely used it once for a test run. Will come back to rate when I have used the product a few more times and provide/resize my ratings.
customer_reviews.author: LucNJ

customer_reviews.title: Gift
customer_reviews.text: Gift for my wife. She loves using her Kitchen aid and wanted to try her hand at making pasta. This was much better than having to roll the pasta out be hand, or buying a hand-crank roller. I can't say with much expertise how effective it was, but it seemed easy to use and she expressed that she was happy with its function.
customer_reviews.author: Bhosley

customer_reviews.title: Easy replacement, good price
customer_reviews.text: Pasta roller broke after 4 uses. Called Amazon who at first connected me with Kitchen Aid for replacement but after KA was slow to respond, Amazon allowed me to return it then sent me a new set. Has worked well since.
customer_reviews.author: John DeAngelo

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as puctured. This set is sturdy, and looks like it will hold up for a lifetime, which is good because I plan on using this a lot. This is very easy to use, clean, and produced the best pasta I have ever had. My husband and I have been looking at pasta makers for some time now kind of shying away from the kitchen aid due to the price tag. But I'm glad we caved in because this is by far the easiest system that I have ever used. I won't be shying away from trusty kitchen aid again.
customer_reviews.author: melanie

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC !!!!  Easy - works as promised!
customer_reviews.text: I had been going back and forth thinking about getting this or not and finally decided to buy it...I only wish I would have done it sooner. It was almost intoxicating to put the dough through the roller and then to cut it into spaghetti..and essentially as long as you want it too. I will probably never buy store bought pasta again since this was so easy and you can freeze the extra pasta for another day.
customer_reviews.author: Robin P.

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to get the plastic combs back in place after cleaning.
customer_reviews.text: Great except if you have to take off the little gray combs for cleaning (if you had too sticky pasta dough) they are impossible to put back in right. Mine are all pushed back and cannot get them out. Go easy on yourself and don't allow sticky pasta dough to go through!
customer_reviews.author: MinkaMink

customer_reviews.title: Great little pasta machine!
customer_reviews.text: Fun little pasta unit maker attachment. Takes a couple tries to figure out how To get the pasta through Evenly. Still a great time with friends and family making pasta. Well-made and well worth adding to your mixer set of tools Still a great time with friends and family making pasta. Well-made and well worth adding to your mixer set of tools
customer_reviews.author: Domenick

customer_reviews.title: Heavy high quality chrome Kitchenaid countertop mixer accessory
customer_reviews.text: This was a huge hit as a Christmas present for my wife. Need to make sure the drive lug is fully seated and the securing knob/screw fully tightened. These accessories are made to last based on their weight; this was a heavy package under the Christmas tree. Chrome finish makes clean up a little easier, which must be done using small brush after dough has dried a bit. As instructions say, these accessories cannot be submersed because this will foul/corrode the roller drive in the end caps. Fresh pasta is fabulous, BTW. Bought a collapsible pasta drying rack as an accompanying gift.
customer_reviews.author: L A

customer_reviews.title: Makes incredible healthy tasty pasta.
customer_reviews.text: Took a few tries to get the dough to the right consistency. Once you slow down and let the sheets of dough get dry enough to let the machine work like it is designed too you get great pasta. Biggest hint. Slow down. USA a drying rack so the dough gets a bit firm then gently flower each side before you run the pasta cutter.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Rocanello

customer_reviews.title: LoveLoveLove
customer_reviews.text: I've used several times and love it. Dust the pasta generously with flour so it doesn't stick. Brush roller/cutter when any residual dough bits have dried out (don't wash in water). This is more expensive than others because made in Italy and all metal construction. I expect it will hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: It's KitchenAid so it's gotta be good,  right?
customer_reviews.text: Well it's getting five stars because it's a KitchenAid product. How well does it work? Is is hard to clean? I have no idea as I bought it for y wife after she said she wanted them while we were watching Hell's Kitchen. They haven't been out of the box since we got them. Haha Still dry box pasta for me Thanks Dear!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: W. R

customer_reviews.title: Great Investment if you Love Pasta
customer_reviews.text: These are a lot of fun and produce great pasta... though expect to put in some work to learn the craft. The main reason to choose these over the manual bit is for the ease involved. The bits themselves are very well built for the task. Be sure to read the manual and follow directions and you will be cranking out the pasta in no time.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S. Ottaway

customer_reviews.title: So nice!
customer_reviews.text: This set is wonderful. It's made pasta making fun and my whole family enjoys watching and helping. It's a great conversation starter when guests come over and see you using it, they will be delighted. It feels very sturdy, heavy and very well made. I imagine if I take good care of it I should be able to hand it down to my kids!
customer_reviews.author: Katie C.

customer_reviews.title: Roller didn’t work after a few times of use
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for a few times, then the roller didn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hull

customer_reviews.title: Another great attachment for my KitchenAid!
customer_reviews.text: Dried pasta is cheap to buy, but fresh tastes so much better. Especially since you can mix in various herbs and spices. But until I got this, I never realized how easy it is to make my own fresh pasta. As with many of the KitchenAid attachments, it's a little bit of a pain to clean, but it still gets 5 stars because it's such a handy tool.
customer_reviews.author: MeadowlarkMT

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: These work phenomenally well and are really fun to use. I really enjoy them as an engaging project with my teenage son, because he likes using them and gets to eat the final product! The dough recipe that comes with them is a good start, but once you get used to it you'll want to look into adding a little semolina.
customer_reviews.author: smilla

customer_reviews.title: Much Easier to Use Than Expected, Amazing Pasta
customer_reviews.text: If you are an intermediate chef looking to up your cooking game, this is the ideal addition to your kitchen repertoire. The first two times I used it, it took about an hour to figure everything out, but now I can make homemade pasta for my family in 30 minutes. The pasta tastes so fresh and light compared to boxed pastas, and I assume that the KitchenAid pasta roller is much easier to use than the old fashioned crank rollers. I joked with my Italian friend that I was cheating by using it, and she said no way the KitchenAid is just as authentic! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pasta press!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say about this? Excellent build quality. Stainless steel, precise adjustments, reliable working. I love this for making my pasta, which I use a lot. Delicate stands of pasta fall off the rollers. It’s a thing of beauty. Would never get rid of this or look for a different one.
customer_reviews.author: The Quintessential Man

customer_reviews.title: The quality of the rollers is perfect
customer_reviews.text: Everything about these pasta rollers feels right. Heavy duty that you can feel from the moment you take one out of the box. There is no apparent backlash or flimsiness in any movable part. The finish seems to be super durable. I put it through the test with my very dry pasta recipe, and it churned like a charm... I am a happy man....
customer_reviews.author: compost

customer_reviews.title: but I like to make unusual things
customer_reviews.text: I can buy regular noodles, but I like to make unusual things. My first attempt was whole wheat spinach lasagne noodles, and they were great! I was able to customize the noodles to the size pan I usually use, so there will be no waste when I make the next batch. I may go one click thinner the next time, though. I made spinach fettuccini with the left-over dough. My kids loved it. We also have a ravioli press (a manual one, not the KitchenAid one), so we will be trying that soon, too.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Hensley

customer_reviews.title: No plastic parts!
customer_reviews.text: There are two similar products from the same brand. This one has no plastic parts and the KPRA has. There are also many products that are not from Kitchen Aid but fit. I haven't tried those but I'm very happy with my KSMPRA 3-Piece Pasta Roller & Cutter. My advice would be: watch reviews on youtube before buying. There are a few good videos where you can see how this works. We've made pasta and empanada shells and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe I waited so long!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE LOVE LOVE this pasta maker attachment! It's simple to use and makes beautiful fresh pasta. The only con of having this is your family will not go back to the box stuff. If you want fresh pasta without the hassle of rolling it out yourself this is a great alternative. It's great knowing the ingredients in your food. This is also easy enough to do with your kids.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: This pasta attachment works well. I've made pasta with both attachments and it has worked well both times. I had to practice a bit with the spaghetti attachment but that was operator error. I like the attachment. It was a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Faith

customer_reviews.title: In my opinion this is a must have attachment for you KitchenAid mixer.
customer_reviews.text: Before I bought this pasta roller set I borrowed the same set from a friend so I could try it out before I bought it. I ordered my own set the same day that I used his. I had no idea how easy it is to make fresh pasta. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Major Combs

customer_reviews.title: Must have for cook in your life!
customer_reviews.text: Never made pasta before and this set makes it like a dream. I’ll never do store bought again.
customer_reviews.author: Yvette

customer_reviews.title: Durable product worth the extra cost
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a cheaper, 3 in 1, attachment. It did nit function because the spindles were misaligned. I could see that the quality of materials was poor and assume that even if it had arrived in functioning order, it would likely malfunction later with use. I returned it snd paid about $50 more to get the Kitchen Aid Product. Obvious superior, stringer materials. Very happy, worth the extra cost for a durable tool
customer_reviews.author: Richard C

customer_reviews.title: Ver well built. Most of all great instructions
customer_reviews.text: I got this yesterday and made spaghetti with it and it is a pleasure to use. I bought a cheaper Antree 3 in one and I recommend that you need to spend a little more and get Kitchenaide KSMPRA model great machine
customer_reviews.author: Clarence Earles

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't imagine making pasta by hand. I got these attachments thinking I'd barely use them, but I'm so impressed that I've already made pasta twice. These attachments are heavy duty and work exactly as they're supposed to. If you let them sit for a while after making pasta, any remaining pasta bits stuck in the machine will dry quickly and brush out easily.
customer_reviews.author: amazonreviewer

customer_reviews.title: What is not to love
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had bought them years ago! I had always wanted a set, but thought, what if the mixer stops working? they I have expensive equipment that is just sitting there! Well, I will always replace my kitchen aid mixer and now I have more reasons to do so! They make noodles so much faster it is crazy!
customer_reviews.author: Snitzel

customer_reviews.title: Everything I hoped it would be...
customer_reviews.text: I have been waiting for a while to get this attachment but I am SO glad that I finally did! It is SO easy to use that even my 4 yr old son got in on the pasta making action. It’s easy to insert into my kitchenAid mixer and the one time that I didn’t screw it in well it was obvious and I simply stopped the machine and reinserted the attachment and made sure I screwed the lock tightly. The attachments are easy to use, switch and clean. I love this product and can’t wait to continue to use it to make more food memories with my friends and family <3
customer_reviews.author: Ingrid

customer_reviews.title: BEST ATTACHMENT
customer_reviews.text: I used to make my pasta without any tools, hands and a rolling pin is all I had. The first time I did pasta from scratch is took me over 4 hours! Using the Kitchenaid attachment cut my time down to literally only 30 minutes of having to roll out all the pieces and run them through the spaghetti or fettuccine attachments. If you are hesitant about this purchase because of the price... TRUST ME its worth it!
customer_reviews.author: amber

customer_reviews.title: Store bought pasta sucks
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I cannot believe I’m almost 30 and have just made pasta for the first time. What a difference in texture. So much better than dried boxed store bought pasta. These roller / cutters are heavy, shiny, and very well made. They are impressive. I feel they will last a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Matejcek

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love it But very unhappy at ups delivery the box it was packed in by amazon was in a horrible shape Luckily KitchenAid had it i a sturdy box so nothing was damaged just the item package was dented
customer_reviews.author: gulnara muradyan

customer_reviews.title: Takes the pain away from kneading and rolling dough!
customer_reviews.text: Wife makes amazing homemade soups with homemade noodles, but working the dough was starting to get too painful. After she used these she was excited how easy and quick it was to make noodles! The mixer mixes the ingredients, but the one roller kneads the dough and then you adjust the same roller to desired thickness. Next, you use one of the noodle slicer and dicer attachments and noodles are made!
customer_reviews.author: Kennif

customer_reviews.title: KitchenAid attachment at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I like what I see but it's a Christmas present for my daughter and will know its overall functionality after she uses it. I'll try to come back after she has a chance to make some pasta and give an update.
customer_reviews.author: martin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I finally got these!! They work well and I am loving making homemade pasta, either by myself or with friends. On that note, these are very feasible to use on your own. I’ve only used the handcrank style machine once and it’s generally helpful to have more than one person on it at a time. These rollers make pasta making quick and pasta easy!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Reese

customer_reviews.title: A must have for kitchenaid fans
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use with my kitchenaid artisan mini and pretty much straight forward. I would recommend not to follow the manufacturer guidelines in pasta as you might wanna adjust the thickness of the pasta yourself. I tried to follow it first time and my pasta was really thin! It's a whole new experience to make pasta at home, the taste would be much better and on long run it's cheaper!
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed Abdulameer

customer_reviews.title: Well made and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I love this pasta maker!! Accidentally purchased an off brand, and after seeing the lack of quality, I returned that product and got this Kitchen Aid pasta maker. It is a much better made product, so heavy duty, and it works like a dream! I love it and expect many, many years of service from this well made product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work!!!
customer_reviews.text: received model KPRA (on box) this is an older model, I payed for the new model. The box appeared to be re-taped, the inside of box was not crisp as in new, And the rollers can't be turned without a lot of force and make a scraping sound. It appears to me that this was a returned unit because it did not work and had numerous finger prints on it. Bait and Switch, or simply a mistake?
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Pasta roller/ cutter
customer_reviews.text: This is very easy to attach to the portal hub of a kitchen aid mixer. Enjoy making my own pasta, but even more fun as an inter active dinner with grandchildren.
customer_reviews.author: Me 2

customer_reviews.title: It's inconvenient to use
customer_reviews.text: After watching the introduction of the video, I thought it would be very easy to use, but when I really use it is not so convenient, I used it twice and put it away all the time!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Huang

customer_reviews.title: No more hand rolling pasta for me!
customer_reviews.text: I've made pasta 3 times so far and it is SOO much easier than the hand crank I used to have, it is difficult to clean out the pasta parts that fall inside, but this taught me there is no such thing as too much flour! The sheet attachment was great for putting basil leaves between two pieces and getting them thin!
customer_reviews.author: Luis Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: A must have 🙏🏻
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift and the feed back I got back is Love it ;the pasta is delicious and it easy to use ones you get used to using it. So thankful for the gift. A must have piece.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great and delish pasta.
customer_reviews.text: I have been rolling homemade pasta for a lot of years. I just got the 3 piece and the 2 piece. I have only used the fettucinni. so far but it was so easy and fast...and fun. . The only thing was the recipe that came with them was dry and crumbly but having made pasta I knew to make it the right consistency by adding water. Love my new "toy". We will be eating a lot more real pasta.
customer_reviews.author: Cupcake

customer_reviews.title: WOW! Excellent Attachement
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to use and easy to clean. Loved this. Made pasta with my daughter and it was fun. In fact, the pasta was secondary to the activity we shared.
customer_reviews.author: DAK

customer_reviews.title: Very nice. Three different attachments. Well made.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter couldn’t wait to try this. Worked great easy to use and with the little brush included it was manageable. It always hard to clean up when you are a beginner pasts maker
customer_reviews.author: Dog Mamma

customer_reviews.title: She loved it best gift ever for the chef
customer_reviews.text: It was a birthday present. After she received it she made lasagna with home made noodles. Super easy to use. Raviolis later this week
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne Blake

customer_reviews.title: Life Changing!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. I used the old fashioned pasta machine for 40 years but now this product has changed my life. Why I didn’t buy this 24 years ago when I first got my Kitchenaid mixer, I have no idea. Makes pasta making quick and fool proof. Quality product
customer_reviews.author: Farmgirl

customer_reviews.title: So glad i got it.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use i made raviolis several times. I used my own dough recipe.I didn't like the recipe provided.Also the dough thickness dial needed to be adjusted to a larger or higher setting. Ounce a got the hang of it ,it worked very well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A fun family activity too!
customer_reviews.text: The price was high, but it’s been on my wish list for a few years. My daughter loves catching the pasta as it rolls out. It’s very easy with great instructions. Homemade pasta is now a weekly item at our house. We are getting better at it each time we try it!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait
customer_reviews.text: Having come from a world of manually rolling out the dough, I got these for my kitchenaid after hearing how much easier it just made everything. My only regret is that I waited this long to get them. I should've done this years ago. They're easy to attach, easy to use, easy to control, and gets me the pasta sheets and noodles much, much faster.
customer_reviews.author: Evigilant

customer_reviews.title: Well made...should last.
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves her pasta machine attachments and I love the fresh pasta! As if I wasn't fat enough! Big difference between store bought and home made!
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: Yummy Pasta!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, these really don't help or hinder the taste of homemade pasta, but they sure make forming the noodles super easy! They may be a little bit of a pain to clean, but it is well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Miovech

customer_reviews.title: I'd like to be able to sanitize them better
customer_reviews.text: Work well but a pain to clean. Can't wash them, you can only wipe with a cloth or use a brush to get extra flour off. Considering pasta dough has raw eggs, I'd like to be able to sanitize them better.
customer_reviews.author: Lola Lu

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase I've made in a long time!! So simple to use, makes homemade pasta so much easier to make! Only problem is that sometimes the dough gets stuck, and all you can do to clean it is use a simple brush (comes with it) after it dries. Definitely cannot be used for both gluten free and normal pasta.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan M.

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for the family!
customer_reviews.text: This kit is great. We've made pasta at least once a week for a few months now. The build quality seems solid and we haven't run into any issues. They are very hard to clean though especially since you can't use Water.
customer_reviews.author: tebruno99

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: These work great! I have a manual one and these save so much time and muss/fuss. I love that you're able to use both hands while rolling out the dough. By all means the manual crank is good, but this is a nice upgrade! I have almost all the attachments for my kitchenaid and these so far get used the most.
customer_reviews.author: Elvis Presley

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to clean. Very sterdy attachment
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy fresh pasta very much. Impossible to clean. Pretty easy to use. I am glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Abby Morganstein

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly good quality
customer_reviews.text: Made in Italy, almost entirely metal parts. I didn't realize how heavy and high quality these were until they arrived. How could a Kitchenaid attatchement be this awesome? Don't bother with the hand cranked model just because you think it's more authentic, you'll regret not going electric when your forearm is killing you.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi

customer_reviews.title: Just what the pasta-maker ordered!
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy and does a perfect job, as long as your pasta dough is okay. (It's easy to make pasta that's too sticky to pass through the rollers, but that's not the rollers' fault.) A bit of a nuisance to clean, but that's a small price to pay.
customer_reviews.author: RoadHazard

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product. I have been waiting a long time for the price to come down and when it did I purchased. It is much easier to use than a hand crank one. This saves a ton of time.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Gouveia

product_meta.title: KitchenAid KSMPRA Pasta Roller & cutter attachment set, Pack of 1, Silver
product_meta.description: Powered by the KitchenAid Stand Mixer, the 3-Piece Pasta Roller & Cutter Set makes fresh pasta from scratch quickly & easily. Includes Pasta Roller, Spaghetti Cutter and Fettuccine Cutter. Made in Italy. For everything you want to make. KitchenAid.
feature_bullets: Designed, engineered, and tested by KitchenAid
Powered by your KitchenAid Stand Mixer. Fits all Household KitchenAid Stand Mixers.
Pasta Roller rolls 6-inch sheets of pasta with 8 thickness settings.
Spaghetti Cutter cuts pasta sheets into classic Spaghetti noodles.
Fettuccine Cutter cuts pasta sheets into hearty Fettuccine noodles.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars2,910 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
